title: Palau XIII Broncos
text:
Palau XIII Broncos also known as Palau XIII or Palau Broncos are a professional <a href="rugby%20league">rugby league</a> team based in <a href="Palau-del-Vidre">Palau-del-Vidre</a> in the <a href="Occitanie">Occitanie</a> region in the south of <a href="France">France</a>. They currently play in the <a href="Elite%20One%20Championship">Elite One Championship</a> which is the top level in France. The club was founded in 1920. They play their matches at the <a href="Stade%20Georges%20Vaills">Stade Georges Vaills</a>.
History.
In 1920 Racing Club Palauenc was formed as a rugby club. They were a feeder team for <a href="USA%20Perpignan">USA Perpignan</a>. Their first silverware arrived in 1928 when they were crowned champion of France's 3rd series. The club switched to Rugby League in 1952 where they competed in the amateur 3rd Division. For such a small club they have a rich history of success. In 1956 they won the 3rd Division title – their first as a Rugby League club.
In 2008 the club completed a league and cup double winning the <a href="Paul%20Dejean%20Cup">Paul Dejean Cup</a> and the <a href="National%20Division%201">National Division 1</a> league, after this success the club took the decision to move up to the semi professional ranks of the <a href="Elite%20Two%20Championship">Elite Two Championship</a>. After five seasons at this level in which they won the competition three times the club decided to move up to the top tier in 2013, promotion being optional. Despite the small size of the club they are still in the <a href="Elite%20One%20Championship">Elite One Championship</a>
The club runs successful youth teams and reserve team through which the club have produced many players top class players including former internationals <a href="Jacques%20Jorda">Jacques Jorda</a>, <a href="Julien%20Touxagas">Julien Touxagas</a> and <a href="David%20Berthezene">David Berthezene</a>
Colours and badge.
Palau XIII Broncos play in red and yellow in various designs, the Broncos moniker was added following their successful promotion in 2008
Stadium.
<a href="Stade%20Georges%20Vaills">Stade Georges Vaills</a> has been the only stadium ever used by the club. The ground is named after a former player of theirs who was born in the area. The ground is situated next to the River Tech and has one main stand. When visiting British clubs are in France to play the <a href="Catalans%20Dragons">Catalans Dragons</a> they frequently use the ground to train on. The ground has hosted two youth Internationals between France and England, on 11 November 2009 France won 22-14 and on 3 June 2011 England won 28-19
